intro: Salvia wixarika, commonly known as Mexican sage, is a perennial shrub native to the central and southern regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of violet to blue-purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping and drought-tolerant gardens. Its medicinal properties have been recognized by indigenous communities for centuries. Salvia wixarika is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
